Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 02:38 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Clifton Terrace area for safety so they can remove some faulty network equipment called a linkbox, from the main network. Our estimated time to have your power back on is between 05:00 and 06:00, however, this may need to change later depending on how our works progress. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Norwich, NR6 7 area to investigate the power cut affecting 455 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Will at 01:21.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 16:23 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Almond Tree Close area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground fault, which our engineers diverted power around.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive on site to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Aaron at 15:20.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Lee, Stuart and Aaron are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 17:08 - We can now confirm that all power in the Charlmont Road area should be back on.

To fix the issue permanently we're trying to find the underlying root cause, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Stuart at 16:58.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Charlmont Road area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 19:00-20:00 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Stuart at 16:49.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 21:16 - We can now confirm that all power in the Brunswick Park Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lee at 21:10 -We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 21:08 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Sent by Stuart at 16:47.

Hi, a final message from us, as I'm pleased to inform you that we believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all customers in the Jedburgh Road area, by repairing a faulty underground connection box. As power has now been restored our customer support vehicle will now attend another job.

For this reason, it's taken us longer than we expected to restore your power today. Please accept our sincere apology as we know that it is difficult to be without power for a longer duration.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To talk to us about this or anything else, call us on 105 which is free from landlines and mobiles. We're really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Just to let you know we're sending our customer support vehicle out to your area.

This can provide hot water, some hot food (or a microwave to heat your own), WIFI, charging points and on site information. We'll let you know once it arrives. Sent by Adam at 15:14.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Aaron from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers have worked to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Sent by Lee at 21:14 - We can now confirm that all power in the Littleport, Feltwell, CB7 4 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around an overhead network fault to get the majority of customers back on. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used a temporary generator to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are awaiting the arrival of our generator.

The temporary generator will remain on site to provide power until we can locate the issue and restore the network back to normal running conditions.

If you'd like any further information, our team are always here to help. Sent by Lee at 21:00.
